bibl.title: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Jose A. Presno, December 31, 1953

div1.p: Armstrong is aware of the existence of diaries by Finlay in the Academy of Sciences Library in Havana. He asks if a microfilm copy could be made for placement in the Armed Forces Medical Library in Washington. He writes Presno that he has asked Hench to act as his representative.

div1.head: Letter from George E. Armstrong to Jose A. Presno, December 31, 1953
div1.opener:
MEDCE-MI
31 December 1953
Dr. José A. Presno
Presidente de la Academia de Ciencias
de la Habana
Cuba 460
Havana, Cuba
Dear Doctor Presno:
div1.p:
Doctor Philip S. Hench has recently called my
attention to the existence of several volumes of the
diary of the illustrious Dr. Carlos Finlay which are
in the Library of your esteemed Academy. The histor-
ical value of these diaries is inestimable and I
would feel greatly indebted to you if suitable ar-
rangements could be made whereby a microfilm copy of
the diaries could be placed in the Armed Forces
Medical Library here in Washington.

I have asked Doctor Hench to act as my repre-
sentative and to call upon you during his visit to
Havana in January 1954, with the view of discussing
suitable arrangements which would allow us to acquire
the desired microfilm, provided you wish to grant my
request. I shall appreciate your kindness in accord-
ing Doctor Hench an opportunity to talk with you
about this matter.

Please accept, Doctor Presno, this expression
of my high consideration and courteous esteem.

closer.signed:
GEORGE E. ARMSTRONG
Major General
The Surgeon General
